page.title: 01The Principal Features
page.content: The lighthouse is an impressive sight. It dominates the river mouth guiding the ships in. Another principal feature is the hill, commonly known as the Braes, sloping steeply up along one side of the river South Esk. The Anat Bank is a dangerous shallow sandbank on which many ships have been wrecked. The Montrose side of the river is quite sandy but the other side is rocky. On the North side of the river is the Glaxo chemical factory, the biggest employer in Montrose. Still by the river is the lifeboat station. It is no longer used but it is still interesting to look at. The lifeboat is now moored in the river. Perhaps the most striking feature is the Links, the biggest tourist attraction. It has two golf courses and a pitch and putt course.
